body.name: THE COMPLETE FLETCHER ADVENTURES BOOKS 1-7 seven thrilling historical naval adventures (Historical Action and Adventure Box Sets)
body.description: DISCOVER THIS COMPLETE ACTION-PACKED, HISTORICAL ADVENTURE SERIES FROM A BESTSELLING AUTHOR.GET SEVEN BOOKS IN ONE GREAT-VALUE BOX SET!Perfect for fans of C.S Forester, Patrick O’Brian, Alexander Kent, Julian Stockwin, Bernard Cornwell and Griff Hosker.ENGLAND, 18TH CENTURY. MEET YOUNG JACOB FLETCHER. APPRENTICE, TRADER AND UNSUSPECTING HEIR OF COIGNWOOD HALL. Fletcher never wanted to be a sailor. He’s done everything imaginable to escape the Navy - including murder and mutiny.When he’s unexpectedly seized by the press gang, Fletcher is compelled to join His Majesty’s fleet and battle against the French.But Fletcher soon discovers that his most formidable adversaries reside much closer to home.PRAISE FOR JOHN DRAKE:‘Swashbuckling adventure on the high seas doesn’t get much better than this.’ Nelson Demille, New York Times bestselling author‘Broad comedy, high drama, plenty of action . . . the genre has room for this cheerily debunking outsider.’ Daily MailBOOK 1: FLETCHER'S FORTUNECornwall, 1793. Jacob Fletcher, a thriving seaport apprentice, is illegally enlisted by the press gang. Forced aboard one of His Majesty's frigate, Fletcher faces perilous dangers and the wrath of the late Sir Henry's widow - who aims to obstruct his inheritance.BOOK 2: FLETCHER'S GLORIOUS 1ST OF JUNE Having earned an honourable discharge from the Royal Navy, Fletcher embarks on a fresh voyage aboard the merchant ship Bednal Green. But his plans are ruined when his ship is captured by American privateers. Fletcher and his crew escape to the British frigate Phiandra on one of the most infamous days in military history: The Glorious First of June.BOOK 3: FLETCHER AND THE MUTINEERS Seeking solace from his cruel stepmother, Fletcher flees to the tropical shores of Jamaica where he might finally make his fortune. But with the island under threat from the evil Vernon Hughes, Fletcher’s dreams of tranquillity are dashed. Across the ocean, Lady Sarah's thirst for revenge remains unquenched.BOOK 4: FLETCHER AND THE GREAT RAID Under Captain Cuthbert Percival-Clive's command on the Serpant, Fletcher adapts to life at sea. Amidst the turmoil of the French-English war, treachery looms. When the sale of valuable steamboat technology threatens the English army, Fletcher must ask himself how far he’s willing to go for his country.BOOK 5: FLETCHER AND THE SAMURAI After years on the high seas, Fletcher confronts the British East India Company's ambition to invade Japan and break free from England's rule. Teaming up with a young samurai, Fletcher braces himself for an impending Japanese civil war.BOOK 6: FLETCHER AND THE BLUE STARSent as a roving ambassador to help defeat the French Navy in America, Fletcher discovers the enigmatic Blue Star — a priceless diamond. Determined to uncover the diamond’s origin, Fletcher embarks on a dangerous journey across Africa. But his efforts will bring him face-to-face with fearsome Zulu leaders.BOOK 7: FLETCHER AND THE FLYING MACHINE Despite flourishing years in trade, Jacob Fletcher is beckoned back to the sea as a commodore, entrusted with the defence of Ireland from the French. His pursuit of a prosperous career takes an unexpected turn as he is forced into the Baltic on a rescue mission. Don’t miss out on this series of unputdownable, action-packed historical adventures. YOU GET ALL SEVEN BOOKS IN THIS EDITION.READERS LOVE JACOB FLETCHER:⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ ‘Brilliant reading, super detail and incredibly descriptive prose.’ Kindle Customer⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ ‘It’s a proper page-turner in the best possible way. Great fun!’ BJN E.⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ ‘Absolutely loved it. It's full of adventure and huge characters.’ Lesley E.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars great fun well written and historically accurate
reviews.reviewText: Fletcher is a great read for those interested in 18th century saling and naval history. Thoughly enjoyed the twisted plots and the general mischief of Fletcher. My biggest disappointment is the lack of an ending and resolution between fletchers and Coignwood. I was waiting the whole time as to how he would finally get his well deserved revenge!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Possibly some relationship to historical facts but well written and fun reading. It’s hard to tell where the history ends and the fiction begins, especially as you work toward the end of the series. The only thing missing is an accurate description of Fletchers wardrobe. Underneath his navel uniform is the Blue suit, yellow cape and a big rd S on the middle of his chest.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic historical fiction!
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely love this series and sincerely hope to read more of Jacob Fletcher's adventures. Mr. Drake has a keen grasp of history, sailing, and gunnery, always keeping the reader in the midst of the action. You'll enjoy these tales of seafaring adventure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This series is so much fun. If you enjoy Hornblower, this is very similar to that, but a bit more rated-R, and much funnier. I hate that I’m finished with it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars what an adventurous romp!
reviews.reviewText: HUZZAH! I loved the period seagoing adventures of Fletcher. I’m now looking for more of author DRAKE'S works to enjoy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good story line. Author has definitely done his research.
reviews.reviewText: The author uses a lot of “fluff” in these books, especially the last three volumes ,it seems, to add meaningless narrative to fill the pages.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Great fun. Enjoyable English Navy adventures from the sailing ship days. You won’t be disappointed from start to finish. Enjoy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was such a great series of books. I was entertained for days.The story was very interesting, and I learned quite a bit about nautical terms.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These books are outstanding. Brilliantly written and will take you through every emotion known to man. I found myself going from hatred for some characters to laughing out loud within the space of a page. Don't worry if historical naval fiction isn't your thing because when you've read them it soon will be. As a proud Yorkie it's got to be one of the best £1.99 I've ever spent.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hilarious, accurate, and worth every second!
reviews.reviewText: There are remarkable similarities between Fletcher and Harry Flashman, to the point where I would say Fletcher is the Flashman of the sea. And thats all to the good! The stories are action-packed, the tone is light, and the characters are wonderful!
What a character! Really enjoyed following the life and adventures of Jacky Flash. Always looking after number one but loved and respected by his crews.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: Great book had me hooked for a couple of months
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed this series of books. My only disappointment was it finished whilst he was still relatively young. If only half those stories were true it would have been an amazing life.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: Beyond Adventure, page turner from start to finish
reviews.reviewText: Engaging historical adventures with captivating characters that kept me engaged and entertained throughout. Captain Fletchers memoirs are presented in a unique style, and I only wish I'd noted down some of his humorous descriptions of situations and characters.I'm looking forward to these adventures making it onto the big screen.Highly recommended read.
